channel.title: Runecrafting!
channel.description:

You click an alter and its gives you runes and rc exp.
but i need it like this:
player has 5 ess: and player has 8 ess: 5 alter replaces 5 with 5 nats alter replaces 8 with 8 nats
etc, how would i do that?

item.title: Runecrafting!
item.dc:creator: @wicked_destiny wicked destiny
item.description:
@wicked_destiny wrote:

o i see u want use a case
then do this

if(playerLevel[20] <= 40) {
for(int i = 0; i < 28; i++) {
if(HasItemAmount(1436, 1)) {
deleteItem(delete,getItemSlot(delete),1);
addItem(561, 1);
addSkillXP((70*playerLevel[7]), 7);
sendMessage("you feel the power of the nature talisman drain into the rune essence");
} else {
sendMessage("you need an runecraft level of 40 to drain the power into the rune essence");
}
}
break;

well its not this exactly now u wont need a tally or tiara…
ill add it…

ill make you a tut

tut :

its a c+p to help ya out

look for this

else if(useItemID == 4834 && atObjectID == 5284) // Bone grinding

above this add :

else if(useItemID == 4834 && atObjectID == 5284 || atObjectID == 5284 && useItemID == 4834 ) // nature runes if(playerLevel[20] <= 40) { for(int i = 0; i < 28; i++) { if(HasItemAmount(1436, 1)) { deleteItem(delete,getItemSlot(delete),1); addItem(561, 1); addSkillXP((70*playerLevel[7]), 7); sendMessage("you feel the power of the nature talisman drain into the rune essence"); } else { sendMessage("you need an runecraft level of 40 to drain the power into the rune essence"); } }

if im not mistaking after u added this it will work

item.title: Runecrafting!
item.dc:creator: @tedyslilnoob tedyslilnoob
item.description:
@tedyslilnoob wrote:

I thought it was this

public void Runecrafting(String message, int exp, int rune, int delete, int ID) { client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ID]; if(c.playerLevel[20] <= 40) { for(int i = 0; i < 28; i++) { if(c.HasItemAmount(1436, 1)) { c.deleteItem(delete,c.getItemSlot(delete),1); c.addItem(rune ,1); c.addSkillXP(exp, 20); c.sendMessage(message); c.setAnimation(791);

But atm, im using item on item:

[/ if ((itemUsed == 1450 || otherItem == 1436)) { deleteItem(1436, 1); addItem(565, 1); sendMessage("you feel the power of the blood talisman drain into the rune essence"); addSkillXP((70*playerLevel[7]), 7); } if ((itemUsed == 1462 || otherItem == 1436)) { deleteItem(1436, 1); addItem(561, 1); sendMessage("you feel the power of the nature talisman drain into the rune essence"); addSkillXP((70*playerLevel[7]), 7); }

but for some reason, its works on ess fine, but if u clcik the itemon any items, it does the same thing except it dont delete

AND

each tali makes both rune types

item.title: Runecrafting!
item.dc:creator: @wicked_destiny wicked destiny
item.description:
@wicked_destiny wrote:

well ok ill explain
you need to add a loop in it

this is a loop

for(int i = 0; i < 28; i++) {

the 0 means that it starts with 0
and stops when it reaches 28 ( your inventory has 28 spots so it wil check 28 spots for essence)

after you added the loop in your code like this

if(playerLevel[20] <= 40) { for(int i = 0; i < 28; i++) {

then you should do this

if(HasItemAmount(1436, 1)) {

this wil do for every one essence cause its a loop you need 1 ess

deleteItem(delete,getItemSlot(delete),1);

this will delete it

addItem(561 ,1);

adds 1 nat for every 1 ess

Read full topic

item.title: Runecrafting!
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

if ((playerHasItemAmount(ESS ID, ESS AMOUNT)==false)) {
sendMessage("Message To Send, If no essence in invent.");
}
else if((playerHasItemAmount(ESS ID, ESS AMOUNT)==true)) {
deleteItem(ESS ID, getItemSlot(ESS ID), ESS AMOUNT);
//Rest of code here.
}

Maybe?
Quick write up, might be few errors.

To add a level req.

if (playerLevel[SKILL NUMBER] >= [LVLREQ])
if ((playerHasItemAmount(ESS ID, ESS AMOUNT)==false)) {
sendMessage("Message To Send, If no essence in invent.");
}
else if((playerHasItemAmount(ESS ID, ESS AMOUNT)==true)) {
deleteItem(ESS ID, getItemSlot(ESS ID), ESS AMOUNT);
//Rest of code here.
}
else if(playerLevel[SKILL NUMBER] <= [LVLREQ]) {
sendMessage("You need a higher level to do this.");
}

:\
